questions.question: On the second Sunday of every month, she goes out to buy biscuits, get her car washed, and meet Rose. Which is the finite verb in the sentence?

Honey tastes sweet.
Is the above sentence grammatically correct?
The verb agrees with the preceding noun or sentence when using:

Seventy-two percent of these machines are outdated.
Is the above sentence grammatically correct?
'Time' is frequently expressed by using a singular verb.

Which sentence is grammatically correct?
I. Thirty percent of this mob is stupid
II. Thirty percent of this mob are stupid.
The verb agrees with the preceding noun or sentence when using indefinite quantifiers.

Which is the finite verb in the sentence below:
'They love eating continental cuisine.'
'Distance' is frequently expressed using a singular verb.
In which case is the subject always placed after the verb?
options: When it starts without any subject

questions.question:
Which Subject-verb Agreement is expressed through the sentence below?
'The majority has supported the ‘go green’ initiative.'
options: When ‘majority’/’minority’ refer to an undetermined number greater or less than 50%, use a singular verb.
When ‘majority’/’minority’ refers to a given percentage, you can use a singular or plural verb.
When the ‘majority’ or ‘minority’ refers to a specific group of people, use a plural verb.

questions.question: 'Money' is frequently expressed using a singular verb.
The verb agrees with the preceding noun or sentence when using fractions.
…………………………….. prefixed by ‘the’ and used as plural nouns require a plural verb:

A number of monkeys were jumping on the terrace.
Is the above sentence grammatically correct?

The number of doctors registered with this NGO is 37.
Is the above sentence grammatically correct?

Which sentence is grammatically correct?
I. An 80% majority stand for the victim.
II. An 80% majority stands for the victim.

Select the correct option with regard to the sentence below:
'David seems to be sad.'
The verb agrees with the preceding noun or sentence when using percentages.
A non-finite Verb does not agree with the subject.

Which sentence(s) is grammatically correct?
I. Half of the cake is gone.
II. Half of the cakes are gone.

Is the sentence below grammatically correct?
'One-fourth of the learners in Robert’s class have requested a short trip to the mountains.'

Is the sentence below grammatically correct?
'Sometimes two quarters of my office time is invested in site visits.'
Choose the grammatically correct sentence.

Is the sentence grammatically correct?
'Around 1% of the water on this planet is contained in snow and ice.'
